Gabba weather forecast: Will it rain on Day 4 of the IND vs AUS Test? - India Today
summary:
Gabba Weather Forecast: Will Rain Impact Day 4 of the IND vs AUS Test?

Published On: Dec 16, 2024

Source: India Today

As the Indian cricket team faces a tough challenge after Day 3 of the Test match against Australia at Gabba, players hope for favorable weather to launch a comeback.

The weather forecast for Gabba indicates a challenging day for India, with heavy rain predicted for the morning session potentially affecting play.

  • India lost 4 wickets for just 51 runs on Day 3.
  • Australia set a formidable first innings total of 445 runs.
  • There is a 99% chance of thundershowers in the morning, likely to wash out the session.
  • Afternoon and evening conditions look better, with no forecasted rain.
  • Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul are crucial for India's chances.
“The morning session is expected to be washed out, but the forecast for the rest of the day is much better.”

Given the current conditions, India's chances hinge greatly on the weather as they seek to fight back against Australia.
newTitle: Gabba Weather Forecast: Will Rain Impact Day 4 of the IND vs AUS Test?

title: Hayden's ‘brotherly’ advice for struggling Rohit Sharma with two ‘trigger words’: 'I'd be saying to him as his partner…' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Hayden's Key Advice to Rohit Sharma: Focus on Intent and Energy

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Legendary Australian cricketer Matthew Hayden has shared crucial advice aimed at helping Indian captain Rohit Sharma regain his batting form. Hayden emphasizes the need for Rohit to bring back his positive intent and energy in his game, especially after a recent struggle with form in red-ball cricket.

  • Rohit has struggled recently, averaging just 11.83 in his last 12 innings.
  • He has sacrificed his opening position for KL Rahul in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • Hayden suggests that Rohit needs to focus on being reactive rather than defensive.
  • He mentions that 'intent' and 'energy' are key 'trigger words' for Rohit.
"When I think of Rohit Sharma, I think of a free-scoring batsman... For purely Rohit Sharma's sake, he needs to have a great intent and energy about him." - Matthew Hayden

In conclusion, Hayden believes that by focusing on intent and energy, Rohit can regain his batting rhythm and confidence, which will ultimately benefit the team.
newTitle: Hayden's Key Advice to Rohit Sharma: Focus on Intent and Energy

title: 'Not made for the new ball': Ex-India cricketer questions Virat Kohli's technique - The Times of India
summary:
Ex-India Cricketer Questions Virat Kohli's Technique Against New Ball

Date: Monday

Source: Times of India

Former India cricketer Cheteshwar Pujara has raised concerns regarding Virat Kohli's technique against the new ball during the ongoing Gabba Test, asserting that his approach may not adequately address the challenges of facing fresh, moving deliveries.

  • Pujara highlights Kohli's struggle against the new ball, having been dismissed during crucial moments.
  • Kohli scored a century against the old ball but has struggled significantly, with only 26 runs in the remaining innings.
  • Pujara suggests that Kohli needs a mental shift rather than just technical adjustments to improve his performance.
  • All of Kohli's dismissals this series have come from catches to slip or wicketkeeper, pointing to issues in execution and mindset.
“His technique is not made for the new ball... If he plays the new ball, the bowlers are fresh, and their confidence is also high.” - Cheteshwar Pujara

Pujara expresses that Kohli's struggles reflect a need for mental adjustments in addition to his practice, as he has failed to apply learned techniques during matches.
newTitle: Ex-India Cricketer Questions Virat Kohli's Technique Against New Ball

title: Time to 'point fingers' as India's batting self-destructs again, reckless shots doom another disappointing collapse - Hindustan Times
summary:
Time to 'point fingers' as India's batting self-destructs again, reckless shots doom another disappointing collapse

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

India's batting line-up once again faced collapse against Australia, with reckless shot selection leading to disappointing totals and creating a hole in the Test match on the third day.

  • India was bowled out for 150 in Perth and 180 in Adelaide, putting them at a severe disadvantage.
  • Jasprit Bumrah excelled with the ball, but the batting failures overshadowed his performance.
  • Shubman Gill and Virat Kohli's dismissals raised questions about their shot selection and discipline.
  • Australia's bowlers, including Mitchell Starc and Josh Hazlewood, exploited India's weaknesses, leading to a deteriorating batting display.
“We don't, as a team, point fingers at each other... maybe you should start pointing fingers.” - Jasprit Bumrah

This ongoing batting crisis indicates a lack of strategy and discipline in India's approach, which could have lasting implications for their performance in this series.
newTitle: India's Batting Collapse Dooms Test Match Against Australia

title: Why Wolves sacked Gary O’Neil and turned to Jorge Mendes again - The Athletic
summary:
Wolves Fire Gary O’Neil and Reunite with Jorge Mendes

Publication Date: December 15, 2024

Source: The Athletic

The Wolverhampton Wanderers have made a significant change in management, parting ways with Gary O'Neil and bringing back renowned super-agent Jorge Mendes for assistance. This decision comes after a string of unsatisfactory performances and a pressing need to turn the team's fortunes around.

  • Wolves turned to Mendes again, after a two-year hiatus, for assistance after failed attempts to find a suitable replacement for O’Neil.
  • Vitor Pereira is now in contention to take over as head coach, with negotiations underway for his release from Al Shabab.
  • The club faced challenges in securing high-profile managers, prompting reliance on Mendes once again.
  • The decision follows a series of poor results, including a demoralizing defeat to Ipswich Town.
  • O’Neil's management troubled by an injury crisis and squad mismanagement.
  • Mendes’s influence is expected to rise following O’Neil's departure, marking a potential return to a past approach to recruitment.
“Even senior figures at Wolves accepted that O’Neil was to a large extent a victim of circumstance.”

In conclusion, Wolves aim to rejuvenate their season with Vitor Pereira at the helm, relying on Mendes's connections to secure essential players during the upcoming transfer window.
newTitle: Wolves Fire Gary O’Neil and Reunite with Jorge Mendes

India captain Rohit Sharma was visibly frustrated during the 3rd Test against Australia in Brisbane, leading to a viral reaction caught on the stump mic.

  • Australia had posted 445 runs, with Rohit yet to score as he navigated a challenging batting situation.

Mumbai's Shreyas Iyer issues firm advice to teammate Prithvi Shaw after their recent SMAT win. The critic advises Shaw to enhance his work ethic for future success.

India's cricket team faces significant challenges in their pursuit of the World Test Championship final, as weather conditions and a potential follow-on against Australia complicate their situation.

  • India was reduced to 4 wickets for 51 runs at stumps, with a follow-on looming if they total below 246 runs.
  • Heavy rain has affected play, raising the possibility of a drawn Test match.
  • India's hopes of reaching the WTC final hinge on winning their remaining matches and the outcomes of other series.
“A second consecutive defeat in the series could end India's chances of making the WTC final for the third straight time.”

The situation is precarious for India, as their qualification for the World Test Championship final now depends on multiple factors, including their performance in upcoming matches and the results of rival teams.

title: Vinod Kambli vs MS Dhoni: How much PENSION these ex-cricketers get from BCCI - India.com
summary:
Vinod Kambli vs MS Dhoni: How much PENSION these ex-cricketers get from BCCI

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: India.com

The article discusses the pension amounts received by former Indian cricketers Vinod Kambli and MS Dhoni, highlighting the differences based on their cricketing careers.

  • Vinod Kambli receives a pension of Rs 30,000 for playing less than 25 Tests.
  • MS Dhoni receives a higher pension of Rs 70,000 for playing over 90 Tests.
  • Kambli's past net worth was Rs 12 to 13 crore, but he is currently reliant on his pension.
  • Dhoni has a net worth exceeding Rs 1000 crore and does not depend solely on his BCCI pension.
  • The article compares their cricketing statistics and financial statuses post-retirement.
"Former India captain MS Dhoni doesn't rely on BCCI pension. He has net worth of over Rs 1,000 crore with interests in various business."

This comparison illustrates the financial disparities faced by retired cricketers based on their international cricket careers.
newTitle: Vinod Kambli vs MS Dhoni: Pension Comparison of Ex-Cricketers

title: D Gukesh, youngest world chess champion, arrives in Chennai to grand welcome - Hindustan Times
summary:
Gukesh D, Youngest World Chess Champion, Receives Hero's Welcome in Chennai

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Gukesh D made a triumphant return to his hometown of Chennai after winning the FIDE World Chess Championship, becoming the youngest champion in history at just 18 years old.

  • Gukesh clinched victory over China's Ding Liren in Singapore in a match that showcased his immense talent.
  • This accomplishment makes him India's second world chess champion, following Viswanathan Anand.
  • Upon his arrival, he was welcomed by a large crowd of fans and reporters, highlighting his new status as a national hero.
  • Gukesh expressed gratitude for the support he received and the significance of bringing the trophy back to India.
  • He was also part of the gold-winning Indian team at the 2024 Chess Olympiad in Budapest.
“Thank you for this reception. I hope we will have a great time in the next few days celebrating together.” - Gukesh D

Gukesh's achievements have inspired many in India and he is seen as a leading figure among the new generation of chess players.
newTitle: Gukesh D, Youngest World Chess Champion, Receives Hero's Welcome in Chennai

title: What Virat Kohli can learn from Sachin Tendulkar's Sydney masterclass - The Times of India
summary:
What Virat Kohli can learn from Sachin Tendulkar's Sydney masterclass

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

The article discusses how Virat Kohli can improve his batting by learning from Sachin Tendulkar’s approach during his unbeaten 241 in Sydney, a pivotal innings that highlighted the importance of patience and adaptability against challenging bowling.

  • Kohli's repeated dismissals outside off-stump raise concerns for his performance.
  • Tendulkar's masterful innings in the 2003-04 series showcased adapting to flaws and challenging conditions.
  • Kohli's eagerness leads to loose shots early in his innings, mirroring Tendulkar’s earlier struggles.
  • Empirical evidence suggests that patience and situational awareness are critical for success.
  • Kohli’s long batting capability can be maximized by restricting risky shots during tough phases.
“Kohli could take a leaf out of this by not allowing bowlers to dictate terms.”

In conclusion, by emulating Tendulkar's disciplined approach, Kohli has the potential to enhance his performance and tackle challenging bowling more effectively.
newTitle: Lessons for Virat Kohli from Sachin Tendulkar's Masterclass in Sydney
